All Other Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText: Niacet Corporation (Niacet) began as a semi commercial chemical plant based on acetylene in 1924. The company is a privately owned corporation with approxmately 85 employees. The facility operates 24 hours per day 365 days per year. The facility occupies 19 acres in a commercial/industrial area. The facility is bordered by property owned by Praxair Corporation to the East. It is bordered by Niagara Falls Boulevard to the North and 47th Street to the West, and Simmons avenue to the South. The nearest residential area is approximately 0.5 miles to the NW. Niacet is a major producer of metal organic acid salts such as Calcium Propionate, Sodium Acetate, and Sodium Phenoxyacetate (SPA) which is used inn the production of Penicillin and Sodium Stearoly Lactylate which is an food grade emulsifier. Niacet produces Monochloroacetic acid which is a raw material for SPA, and is also sold on the merchant market. Chlorine is used to produce Monochloroacetic acid. Anhydrous Hydrogen Chloride is a by product of monochloroacetic acid manufacture. Niacet has 2 10,000 gallon AHCl storage tanks that can hold a maximum of 70,000 lbs each for a total of 140,000 lbs. Niacet may fill one 21,000 lb anhydrous hydrogen chloride tube trailer at a time from the process. The tube trailer consists of seven 3,000 lb capacity tubes. The filled tube trailer is then released for delivery to customers. 600lb and 60 lb cylinders are also filled and released for delivery to customers. Safety systems include hydrogen chloride sensors, automatic shutoff valves, and video monitors.  Ethyl ether is used to manufacture  anionic surfactants. Chlorine is received via railcar and transferred through a vaporizer into 1 of 2 reactors for the production of Monochloroacetic acid. Niacet may have up to 2 chlorine railcars on site for a total of 360,000 lbs. Safety systems include chlorine sensors, automatic shutoff valves, and video monitors. Ethyl ether is received via tank truck and is stored into 1 of 2 14,000

gallon storage tanks. Administrative controls limit the amount of Ethyl Ether on site to <10,000 lbs. Ethyl ether is used in the manufacture of  anionic surfactants. Offsite consequence analysis for a worst case scenario for ethyl ether does not affect areas outside of the facility. The ethyl ether is a processing aid which is recycled and reused in these processes. Safety systems include heat sensors that can activate a water deluge system, sprinklers, and LEL monitors and alarms. Niacet has a management system in place to oversee the implementation of the RMP program elements. The Manager, Quality Assurance & Regulatory Affairs has the overall responsibility for the development, implementation and integration of the RMP program elements. The Manager, Quality Assurance & Regulatory Affairs reports directly to the CEO He may assign responsibility of individual program elements to individuals identified in the Niacet organizational chart. Niacet is committed to operate our Niagara Falls, NY based facility in a safe and responsible manner. Our long history of no off site releases of regulated chemicals speaks for itself. This is due to the layers of safeguards in place to prevent the accidental release of hazardous substances. In the unlikely event of a chemical release, comprehensive emergency response plans are in place to bring any situation to a safe resolution. Niacet meets regularly with emergency responders and conducts ongoing training of employees and emergency responders to be prepared in the unlikely event of an emergency situation. Accident prevention is a key element of our RMP plan. We take a systematic approach to preventing the accidental release of hazardous chemicals. Niacet's RMP plan includes the adoption of OSHA's accidental release prevention program. Some key elements include : Operating procedures, Process safety information, Process Hazards analysis, Training, Mechanical integrity, Incident investigation, Compliance audits, Management of Chang

e, Contractor Management, Pre-startup Review, and Employee Participation. Continual improvement is key to our success. This includes our joint Union/Management safety committee. Review of plant procedures, near misses, incident investigation programs, solicitation of suggestions, and the maintenance of regularly scheduled comprehensive safety meetings.
